message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: BufferedReader f = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("input.txt"));
String newLine;
ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> input = new ArrayList<>();

while ((newLine = f.readLine()) != null) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(newLine);
    ArrayList<Integer> line = new ArrayList<>();

    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        int i1 = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
        System.out.println("Adding to list: " + i1);
        line.add(i1);
    }

    input.add(line);
}

f.close();
System.out.println(input);
<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, I have modified it to create a new ArrayList<Integer> for each line of input. Inside the inner while loop, I am correctly using st.hasMoreTokens() to check if there are more tokens in the current line. If there are, I parse the next token as an integer and add it to the line ArrayList. Finally, I add the line ArrayList to the input ArrayList.
